channel.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
channel.description: I'm creating a tutorial island on my server so I want to make something that teleports the players to the area to start, Anyways: How do I make it so after the player kills the NPC (rat) they are allowed to talk to the NPC (Guide) to teleport them to somewhere else, Ex: I'm sending dialougs instead, saying "Lets go to the Mage training area." And if they havent killed the (rat) it sends a message saying 'Kill the rat first, then talk to me." I will Rep++.

item.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:7, topic:375303”]Sir jay is correct by saying create a boolean, I’ll show you a step by step guide.

Okay, so I assume you have the NPC’s set up and the talk animation ect. From here just paste these codes where I tell you.

Under

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
in client.java paste

public boolean killedRat = true;

Now under the NPC dialogue you need to put the code, Here’s a small example.

case 1: talk("Hello, you are new to this boolean shit, follow this and you'll be fine - Saphire`", 454); break; else if boolean killedRat = false; case 1: talk("Sorry, you need to kill the rat first.", 454); break;

Hope this helps you understand the concept.[/quote]

thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

cough should be declared as false cough

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Sir jay is correct by saying create a boolean, I’ll show you a step by step guide.

Okay, so I assume you have the NPC’s set up and the talk animation ect. From here just paste these codes where I tell you.

Under

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
in client.java paste

public boolean killedRat = true;

Now under the NPC dialogue you need to put the code, Here’s a small example.

case 1: talk("Hello, you are new to this boolean shit, follow this and you'll be fine - Saphire`", 454); break; else if boolean killedRat = false; case 1: talk("Sorry, you need to kill the rat first.", 454); break;

Hope this helps you understand the concept.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If you use my method, then you need to make it a public field! (public boolean killedRat = true;)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

… Either at the top of the class where the class is defined under the brace ({) add public boolean killedRat = true; or if you are initializing a variable inside a method and you don’t need it anywhere outside the method then inside your method use boolean killedRat = false;

I learnt from http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/ and you can too!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help. Rep++
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Lord Typhis, post:3, topic:375303”][quote author=Sir Jay link=topic=471257.msg3446669#msg3446669 date=1293486772]
Maybe use a boolean so after the player has killed the rat, return the boolean to something - let’s say killedRat = true; but initialize the variable as killedRat = false;

and then under the dialogue just add something like && killedRat == true) {

meh too lazy to add much code so if you want, wait for someone else to help or gather from what i’ve told you and research some java. But that is how I would make it so once you have killed the rat only then can you talk to the npc
[/quote]

Where would I add the Boolean?[/quote]
There’s probably a method somewhere that’s called when the player kills an NPC. Go to that, add an if statement for the rat’s NPC ID and set the killedRat boolean to true.

You can then check this when you talk to the guide NPC.

Read full topic
